attributes.additional_details: Preserving the Wartime Heritage of                     'RAF Holwell Hyde' which was home to the Decoy Factory, which distracted German Bombs from the Mosquito Production Lines at Hatfield Dehavilland; later to become RAF Panshanger and home to 'No 1 Elementary Flight Training School', which saw 5000 Pilot Officers pass through to receive their Wings and help win the Second World War, flying Tiger Moth   Bi-Planes.  This RAF Station contributed to the National War Effort in its own right.  This aerodrome's Wartime History has Not Been Addressed Properly or Protected From Past Development; this is an International Masterpiece, that Must be Preserved and Restored for future generations.  I want the Government to Start to Respect the 'Sacrifice Reminders' of Former RAF Aerodromes.
